sentences: Daniel Patrick Adair (born February 19, 1975 in Vancouver) is a Canadian drummer, percussionist, and producer.
This band, named Martone, recorded its first album in 1999.
In 2002, Adair joined the multi-platinum, Mississippi based band 3 Doors Down, as the touring and studio drummer.
During his time with the band they recorded the studio album Seventeen Days and live album Another 700 Miles, toured 14 countries and had multiple TV appearances.
In 2005, they released the album All the Right Reasons which debuted at #1 on Billboard and went multi-platinum.
The follow-up album was Dark Horse; the first single on that album, "Gotta Be Somebody", was released on September 29 in North America.
On October 21, 2007, James Stephen Hart (former frontman of Eighteen Visions) announced that Adair was recording drum tracks for his new band, Burn Halo.
In 2011, Adair along with the other band members of Nickelback released Here and Now.
In 2011, Adair along with the other band members of Nickelback released Here and Now.
Adair holds a private pilot licence, originally learning to fly on ultralight aircraft, and currently owns a Maule M-7.
In 2020, Adair was diagnosed with radial tunnel syndrome.
